Title.evidence: Intraoperative End-Tidal Carbon Dioxide and Recurrence-Free Survival in Pancreatic Cancer Surgery: A Retrospective Cohort Study

Participants.evidence: 652 patients undergoing elective pancreatic cancer resection at Heidelberg University Hospital from 2009 to 2016

Intervention.evidence: Patients were divided into high-EtCO2 and low-EtCO2 groups based on mean intraoperative EtCO2 values

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the association between EtCO2 levels and recurrence-free survival in pancreatic cancer surgery

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was recurrence-free survival

Number_Randomised.evidence: 652 patients undergoing elective pancreatic cancer resection at Heidelberg University Hospital from 2009 to 2016

Result_Outcome.evidence: Recurrence-free survival did not differ between groups [HR = 1.043 (95% CI: 0.875â€“1.243), p = 0.909]

Harms.evidence: secondary outcomes including cardiovascular events, surgical site infections, sepsis, reoperations, and overall survival
